page.title: 03The Ash Ranges Ecology.
page.content: The soil is poor, dry and sandy. Most of the Ranges is covered with Common Bracken which grows to a height of 2 metres. It is ideal cover for the animal life such as deer, rabbits and foxes. There are badger setts too and many snakes - adders, grass and smooth snakes and also lizards. The grey squirrel is seen along with many birds in the deciduous trees. Trees such as Sweet and Horse Chestnut, Ash, Mountain Ash or Rowan, Beech, Oak, Lime and Silver Birch. There are many coniferous trees too, namely Pines, Larch, Grand Fir and Noble Fir. There are a few wet patches on the Ranges as the whole area has a high water table. There are Bullrushes growing in these areas. Many wild flowers grow in abundance. Grasses and fungi grow in selected areas.
